content.title: Decoding urban climate with geospatial techniques : GEE Workshop
content.description:
Jointly Organised by the Bengaluru Sustainability Forum (BSF) and Center for Science, Technology and Policy (CSTEP).

This workshop seeks to demonstrate open-source geospatial technology and its use in enhanced mapping for observing and assessing urban characteristics and climate influence in the Bengaluru urban area. (This is an in-person workshop and will not have an online component)

Application deadline: 6th March 2024. Selected candidates will be notified by 8th March 2024.

To apply : https://forms.gle/LsC2t8HopxfmvNSN8

Eligibility:

· Masters or PhD in Geography/Environmental Sciences/Urban Planning/Geomatics/Geo-informatics/Remote Sensing/Earth Sciences/Social Sciences/Civil Engineering/Ecological conservations/Health and Air Quality/Applied Sciences. · Alternatively, a minimum of 2 years' research and development experience in a relevant field. · Open to professionals from local, regional, state, and non-governmental organizations engaged in urban studies, disaster management, rural development, etc.

Note: If you do not fall under any of the above groups and believe that this workshop aligns with your work, you can still fill up the form.

The workshop has a limited number of seats and is offered at no charge.
content.location: National Centre for Biological Sciences, Bengaluru

content.title: Critical Zones : in search of a common ground- public exhibition
content.description:
Exploring new modes of coexistence between all forms of life.

Join Science Gallery Bengaluru and Goethe-Institut / Max Mueller Bhavan Bangalore in exploring how research at the intersection of art and science might help mitigate the impacts of climate change at Critical Zones. In Search of a Common Ground. This multimedia exhibition aims to explore our place on Earth’s ‘Critical Zones’, and how these zones have evolved through time. Featuring over 25 artists from India and around the world, the exhibition will be on display at Science Gallery Bengaluru until March 17, 2024.
content.location: Science Gallery, Bellary Road, Sanjaynagar, Bengaluru- 560024
